title: Firefox does not display local html files
content:
Hello,

I am learning web development and I was told to use Firefox as my IDE because of its developer options. But whenever I try to display a .html file all I get is a blank page although I can view the file in Microsoft Edge.

Also when I check page source or inspect page, I can view my .html code in the background but on the frontend I get a blank page.


Please could you guys help please? I don't know what to do


Thank you
creator: ama.iykeuzo

title: fillable pdf form
content:
Using FF 85.0.2

I created a fillable pdf using Adobe Acrobat. It worked at first then (I'm guessing after a FF upgrade but I don't know specifically when) all the fillable fields switched from portrait orientation to landscape.

We don't normally fill this manually. We use ColdFusion to fill the fields programatically and our browser of choice is FF.

I open the form in FF (including the Developer's Edition) (https://inlocc.stg.cfwebhost.iu.edu/BlankClaimForm.pdf) and, clicking in a fillable field, it is in landscape mode (in the field) aligned center.

When I open the form in any other browser (Opera, Explorer, Chrome) and it opens properly.

This implies a bug (this is NOT a feature!) in FF. ????
creator: stephenl314

title: Delete a bookmark from a searchbar with Shift + Delete
content:
Why doesn't Shift + Delete delete a bookmark from a searchbar? Here is a simple example: Example of deleting history/bookmark

It works like a charm for history items but not for bookmarks. How to fix it? Maybe some options must be turned on? Since it is possible for deleting history items why it's not possible for bookmarks? Maybe you know any extension with this functionality?

title: Firefox hangs when printing
content:
Whenever I press 'print', Firefox hangs repeatedly for ~15 seconds. After ~15s it will respond again for ~4 seconds, before hanging again for ~15s.

I've tried running in Safe mode: same problem.

I've tried reinstalling Firefox: same problem.

I do not have this problem in Chrome.

Has anyone else solved this problem? Please can anyone help?

Thank you! David

title: Visor PDF
content:
Hola,

Estoy buscando saber cual es estandar ISO y nivel utilizado en el visor PDF del navegador.

Cual es el estandar:

ISO 15930 ISO 19005-1 ISO 24517-1 ISO 32000-1 ISO 14289-1

Cual es el nivel:

PDF/A-1a PDF/A-1b

PDF/A-1 PDF/A-2

Algunos de ellos corresponde con el ISO y nivel del visor PDF del navegador, ¿como podria saber el estandar y el nivel?.
creator: sdcn200

title: How to remove username suggestions
content:
I've got the following problem: When you try to log in to a website you have already visited, Firefox automatically shows you account names you have already used. I've accidentally typed my password into the box and now its displayed there. How can I fix this?

Thanks a lot in advance!
creator: cassian.hinterhuber

title: Individual Sync Settings
content:
Hello,

is it possible to have individual sync settings for different instances of Firefox? In my case I would like to sync passwords only between my desktop instances and not to my android instance. But every time when I deselect the password sync option on Android it is also deactivated on all other instances. Having the passwords synced to Android is, in my opinion, a security issuse since the Android version of Firefox does not require any unlock procedure (password, pin, pattern, fingerprint, ...) before the stored paswords and log-in data can be used.

Best regards, Heiko
creator: MrZeroPercent_659466216

title: Changing an add-on icon color?
content:
Hello!

I have just installed the Simple Tab Groups add-on and moved it to tab bar (using the Customize menu), but unfortunately its icon remains black since it is an add-on, so it doesn't have a gray/white variant like the the native Firefox buttons. Since I use the default theme in Firefox my tab bar is black all the time (and I need/want to keep it that way) so what I'd like to do is just recolor the Simple Tab Groups add-on icon myself. I just have no idea where the icon data is stored and how I could do so.

Help is appreciated!

-FB-Productions

title: Does anyone know how to make Firefox warn me when I hit Close on a single tab?
content: Does anyone know how to make Firefox warn me when I hit Close on a single tab? Occasionally I accidentally hit the "X" on a single tab that I didn't intend to close. I've searched Help with [warn close "single tab"] but very apparent that putting 2 words in quotes does NOT require them to be together in the search. It returns 106 pages! I saw that it was do-able in older versions of Firefox but since they changed the field to True or False you can't put a 2 in it. I think Firefox is great except for this very irritating flaw. Thank you..
